qas.question: What is an English translation of the title of Popper's doctoral thesis?

answers.text: The question of method in cognitive psychology

qas.question: What subjects was Popper authorized to teach in secondary school in 1929?
Whose rise to power motivated Popper to publish his work in hopes of obtaining an academic position abroad?
In which work published in 1934 did Popper introduce his theories centered around falsifiability?
When did Karl Buhler earn a doctorate in psychology?
What was the title of Buhler's dissertation?
When was Popper barred from teaching math in secondary school?
What was the title of Popper's last book?
What kind of leave did Popper use to visit Italy?

context: In <b5_0>1928<b5_0/>, he earned a doctorate in psychology, under the supervision of <a0_0>Karl Bühler<a0_0/>. His dissertation was entitled "<b6_0>Die Methodenfrage der Denkpsychologie<b6_0/>" (<a1_0>The question of method in cognitive psychology<a1_0/>). In <b7_0>1929<b7_0/>, he obtained the authorisation to teach <a2_0>mathematics and physics<a2_0/> in secondary school, which he started doing. He married his colleague Josefine Anna Henninger (1906–1985) in 1930. Fearing the rise of <a3_0>Nazism<a3_0/> and the threat of the Anschluss, he started to use the evenings and the nights to write his first book <b8_0>Die beiden Grundprobleme der Erkenntnistheorie<b8_0/> (The Two Fundamental Problems of the Theory of Knowledge). He needed to publish one to get some academic position in a country that was safe for people of Jewish descent. However, he ended up not publishing the two-volume work, but a condensed version of it with some new material, Logik der Forschung (<a4_0>The Logic of Scientific Discovery<a4_0/>), in 1934. Here, he criticised psychologism, naturalism, inductionism, and logical positivism, and put forth his theory of potential falsifiability as the criterion demarcating science from non-science. In 1935 and 1936, he took <b9_0>unpaid<b9_0/> leave to go to the United Kingdom for a study visit.
